article_title: Legislature seeks new Medicaid expert to review expansion policy
article_text: Walker's administration said expansion would save millions of dollars and boost Alaska's economy by bringing more federal money into the state. But the Republican-controlled Legislature rejected Walker's proposal earlier this year, with members saying they were concerned about Medicaid's growing costs. They said the program needed to be reformed, not necessarily expanded.

article_metadata.description: The Alaska Legislature plans to hire a consultant to help lawmakers separate fact from fiction in the debate over expansion and reform of the public Medicaid health care program.

og.description: The Alaska Legislature plans to hire a consultant to help lawmakers separate fact from fiction in the debate over expansion and reform of the public Medicaid health care program.
og.title: Legislature seeks new Medicaid expert to review expansion policy

article_summary:
But the Republican-controlled Legislature rejected Walker's proposal earlier this year, with members saying they were concerned about Medicaid's growing costs.
They said the program needed to be reformed, not necessarily expanded.
Walker's administration said expansion would save millions of dollars and boost Alaska's economy by bringing more federal money into the state.
